SENT.plain: Two patients are described with elevation of circulating somatomedin A concentration but normal growth hormone levels
One,a young male, appeared clinically acromegalic; the other, a young female, was tall with kyphoscoliosis, and her appearance resembled Marfan's syndrome
In both patients plasma growth hormone concentration was suppressible by hyperglycaemia
It is suggested that their clinical syndromes resulted from excessive somatomedin activity
